intro: Pterocephalus perennis f. longipedunculatus, commonly known as the long pedunculate pterocephalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. This variety is noted for its elongated peduncles, which distinguish it from other forms of Pterocephalus perennis.
